DOC.HEAD: Woman Convicted Of Blowing Air Into Hospitalized Child's Feeding Tube
DOC.TEXT: A woman faces up to life in prison and a $10,000 fine after a jury convicted her of injuring her brain-damaged son by blowing air through a feeding tube while the infant was hospitalized. Brenda Garza, 23, of Lake Jackson, was secretly videotaped by authorities at Texas Children's Hospital on June 8. Hospital officials became concerned because the condition of Jesus Garza III improved when he was with nurses but deteriorated after his mother's visits. On the tape, she was seen blowing air into a tube that had been inserted into the child's stomach. She also appeared to hold her fingers against the child's windpipe. She then complained to a nurse that her child's stomach was swollen. When the nurse would leave, the woman would blow through the tube again, prosecutor Jan Krocker said. Jurors who convicted her of the first-degree felony Thursday and now must consider punishment. Ms. Garza's attorney, Felix Cantu, said his client deserved a second chance and wants jurors to consider probation.
